lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Outsiders like the World Bank are reluctant to suggest possible solutions to Brazil's economic problems because of the delicate political situation there, he added.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Brazil still seems willing to talk to the Fund under the annual discussions that all IMF members undertake, Conable said, adding that this could partially solve the current stalemate.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: He said Brazil had caught the attention of the world with its decision last month to stop paying interest on its loans from commercial banks but warned it not to sqaunder the time it gained by failing to come up with a new economic program.

lst.name: sentence
